definitions.definition: To put down ; to lay down ; to deposit ; to lay aside ; to put away .
To remove (a leader ) from (high) office without killing (them).
examples: A deposed monarch may go into exile as pretender to the lost throne, hoping to be restored in a subsequent revolution.

definitions.definition: To give evidence or testimony , especially in response to interrogation during a deposition .
To interrogate and elicit testimony from during a deposition , typically by a lawyer .
examples: After we deposed the claimant we had enough evidence to avoid a trial.

definitions.definition: To take or swear an oath .
To testify ; to bear witness ; to claim ; to assert ; to affirm .

main_definition: ( literally , transitive ) To put down ; to lay down ; to deposit ; to lay aside ; to put away .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To remove (a leader ) from (high) office without killing (them).
( law , intransitive ) To give evidence or testimony , especially in response to interrogation during a deposition .
( law , transitive ) To interrogate and elicit testimony from during a deposition , typically by a lawyer .
( intransitive ) To take or swear an oath .
To testify ; to bear witness ; to claim ; to assert ; to affirm .
